Module c195.c195
Package Controllers

Class AddCustomerController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.AddCustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddCustomerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
AddCustomerController handles adding a new customer in the AddCustomer view. User input is taken and a new customer is generated after input validation is performed.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initialize sets the country combo box. The division combo box is not set here because its values based on the country selected
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • addCustomerSave

      public void addCustomerSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException
      addCustomerSave first gets the local time and converts it to UTC for the DB. All text fields and combo box values are then assigned to variables, and null checks are performed to ensure user input. Validation is performed, and if validation passes, an INSERT statement is run to create a new customer. The user is then redirected to the main customer view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      SQLException

    • addCustomerCancel

      public void addCustomerCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      addCustomerCancel redirects the user to the CustomerMain view without saving any input.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • setCountryComboBox

      private void setCountryComboBox()
      setCountryComboBox is run when the AddCustomer view is visited. A query is made to the db to get all countries, and that data then populates the countryList, which is then used to populate the country combo box. LAMBDA #2 - A lambda function is used in set Country Combo Box to set all of the countries in the combo box. It does this by iterating through the full country list, adding the current 'country' to the CustomerCountryCombo list This makes the code more readable for other developers and is therefore more maintainable.

    • setDivisionComboBox

      private void setDivisionComboBox(int Country_ID)
      setDivisionComboBox is called whenever a country is selected from the country combo box. Once a country is selected, a query is run on the first_level_divisions table where that country's ID matches that division. The division combo box is then populated with those values.
      Parameters:
      Country_ID -

    • addCustomerCountryCombo

      public void addCustomerCountryCombo(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      When a country is selected, this method is run. It selects the country ID for use in the setDivisionComboBox method. It also enables the division Combo Box, which had been disabled until a country was selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
